name: iron-dropdown

properties.name: focused
properties.description: If true, the element currently has focus.

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: If true, the user cannot interact with this element.

properties.name: keyEventTarget
properties.description:
The EventTarget that will be firing relevant KeyboardEvents. Set it to
`null` to disable the listeners.

properties.name: stopKeyboardEventPropagation
properties.description:
If true, this property will cause the implementing element to
automatically stop propagation on any handled KeyboardEvents.

properties.name: keyBindings
properties.description:
To be used to express what combination of keys  will trigger the relative
callback. e.g. `keyBindings: { 'esc': '_onEscPressed'}`

properties.name: sizingTarget
properties.description:
The element that will receive a `max-height`/`width`. By default it is the same as `this`,
but it can be set to a child element. This is useful, for example, for implementing a
scrolling region inside the element.

properties.name: fitInto
properties.description: The element to fit `this` into.

properties.name: noOverlap
properties.description: Will position the element around the positionTarget without overlapping it.

properties.name: positionTarget
properties.description:
The element that should be used to position the element. If not set, it will
default to the parent node.

properties.name: horizontalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the dropdown content
horizontally relative to the dropdown trigger.
Overridden from `Polymer.IronFitBehavior`.

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the dropdown content
vertically relative to the dropdown trigger.
Overridden from `Polymer.IronFitBehavior`.

properties.name: dynamicAlign
properties.description:
If true, it will use `horizontalAlign` and `verticalAlign` values as preferred alignment
and if there's not enough space, it will pick the values which minimize the cropping.

properties.name: horizontalOffset
properties.description:
A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the
given `horizontalAlign`, in the direction of alignment. You can think
of it as increasing or decreasing the distance to the side of the
screen given by `horizontalAlign`.

If `horizontalAlign` is "left", this offset will increase or decrease
the distance to the left side of the screen: a negative offset will
move the dropdown to the left; a positive one, to the right.

Conversely if `horizontalAlign` is "right", this offset will increase
or decrease the distance to the right side of the screen: a negative
offset will move the dropdown to the right; a positive one, to the left.

properties.name: verticalOffset
properties.description:
A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the
given `verticalAlign`, in the direction of alignment. You can think
of it as increasing or decreasing the distance to the side of the
screen given by `verticalAlign`.

If `verticalAlign` is "top", this offset will increase or decrease
the distance to the top side of the screen: a negative offset will
move the dropdown upwards; a positive one, downwards.

Conversely if `verticalAlign` is "bottom", this offset will increase
or decrease the distance to the bottom side of the screen: a negative
offset will move the dropdown downwards; a positive one, upwards.

properties.name: autoFitOnAttach
properties.description: Set to true to auto-fit on attach.

properties.name: opened
properties.description: True if the overlay is currently displayed.

properties.name: canceled
properties.description: True if the overlay was canceled when it was last closed.

properties.name: withBackdrop
properties.description:
Set to true to display a backdrop behind the overlay. It traps the focus
within the light DOM of the overlay.

properties.name: noAutoFocus
properties.description:
Set to true to disable auto-focusing the overlay or child nodes with
the `autofocus` attribute` when the overlay is opened.

properties.name: noCancelOnEscKey
properties.description: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay with the ESC key.

properties.name: noCancelOnOutsideClick
properties.description: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay by clicking outside it.

properties.name: closingReason
properties.description:
Contains the reason(s) this overlay was last closed (see `iron-overlay-closed`).
`IronOverlayBehavior` provides the `canceled` reason; implementers of the
behavior can provide other reasons in addition to `canceled`.

properties.name: restoreFocusOnClose
properties.description: Set to true to enable restoring of focus when overlay is closed.

properties.name: alwaysOnTop
properties.description: Set to true to keep overlay always on top.

properties.name: animationConfig
properties.description: Animation configuration. See README for more info.

properties.name: entryAnimation
properties.description:
Convenience property for setting an 'entry' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.entry`
manually if using this. The animated node is set to `this` if using this property.

properties.name: exitAnimation
properties.description:
Convenience property for setting an 'exit' animation. Do not set `animationConfig.exit`
manually if using this. The animated node is set to `this` if using this property.

properties.name: openAnimationConfig
properties.description:
An animation config. If provided, this will be used to animate the
opening of the dropdown. Pass an Array for multiple animations.
See `neon-animation` documentation for more animation configuration
details.

properties.name: closeAnimationConfig
properties.description:
An animation config. If provided, this will be used to animate the
closing of the dropdown. Pass an Array for multiple animations.
See `neon-animation` documentation for more animation configuration
details.

properties.name: focusTarget
properties.description:
If provided, this will be the element that will be focused when
the dropdown opens.

properties.name: noAnimations
properties.description:
Set to true to disable animations when opening and closing the
dropdown.

properties.name: allowOutsideScroll
properties.description:
By default, the dropdown will constrain scrolling on the page
to itself when opened.
Set to true in order to prevent scroll from being constrained
to the dropdown when it opens.

properties.name: containedElement
properties.description: The element that is contained by the dropdown, if any.

methods.name: addOwnKeyBinding
methods.description:
Can be used to imperatively add a key binding to the implementing
element. This is the imperative equivalent of declaring a keybinding
in the `keyBindings` prototype property.

methods.name: removeOwnKeyBindings
methods.description: When called, will remove all imperatively-added key bindings.

methods.name: keyboardEventMatchesKeys
methods.description: Returns true if a keyboard event matches `eventString`.

methods.name: fit
methods.description: Positions and fits the element into the `fitInto` element.

methods.name: resetFit
methods.description:
Resets the target element's position and size constraints, and clear
the memoized data.

methods.name: refit
methods.description:
Equivalent to calling `resetFit()` and `fit()`. Useful to call this after
the element or the `fitInto` element has been resized, or if any of the
positioning properties (e.g. `horizontalAlign, verticalAlign`) is updated.
It preserves the scroll position of the sizingTarget.

methods.name: position
methods.description: Positions the element according to `horizontalAlign, verticalAlign`.

methods.name: constrain
methods.description:
Constrains the size of the element to `fitInto` by setting `max-height`
and/or `max-width`.

methods.name: center
methods.description:
Centers horizontally and vertically if not already positioned. This also sets
`position:fixed`.

methods.name: notifyResize
methods.description:
Can be called to manually notify a resizable and its descendant
resizables of a resize change.

methods.name: assignParentResizable
methods.description:
Used to assign the closest resizable ancestor to this resizable
if the ancestor detects a request for notifications.

methods.name: stopResizeNotificationsFor
methods.description:
Used to remove a resizable descendant from the list of descendants
that should be notified of a resize change.

methods.name: resizerShouldNotify
methods.description:
This method can be overridden to filter nested elements that should or
should not be notified by the current element. Return true if an element
should be notified, or false if it should not be notified.

parameters.name: element
parameters.description:
A candidate descendant element that
implements `IronResizableBehavior`.

methods.name: backdropElement
methods.description: The backdrop element.

methods.name: toggle
methods.description: Toggle the opened state of the overlay.

methods.name: open
methods.description: Open the overlay.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Close the overlay.

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: Cancels the overlay.

methods.name: invalidateTabbables
methods.description:
Invalidates the cached tabbable nodes. To be called when any of the focusable
content changes (e.g. a button is disabled).

methods.name: getAnimationConfig
methods.description:
An element implementing `Polymer.NeonAnimationRunnerBehavior` calls this method to configure
an animation with an optional type. Elements implementing `Polymer.NeonAnimatableBehavior`
should define the property `animationConfig`, which is either a configuration object
or a map of animation type to array of configuration objects.

methods.name: playAnimation
methods.description: Plays an animation with an optional `type`.

methods.name: cancelAnimation
methods.description: Cancels the currently running animations.

properties.name: event
properties.description:
The closing of the overlay can be prevented
by calling `event.preventDefault()`. The `event.detail` is the original event that
originated the canceling (e.g. ESC keyboard event or click event outside the overlay).

properties.name: event
properties.description:
The `event.detail` is the `closingReason` property
(contains `canceled`, whether the overlay was canceled).

description:
`` is a generalized element that is useful when you have hidden content (`dropdown-content`) that is revealed due to some change in state that should cause it to do so. Note that this is a low-level element intended to be used as part of other composite elements that cause dropdowns to be revealed. Examples of elements that might be implemented using an `iron-dropdown` include comboboxes, menubuttons, selects. The list goes on. The `` element exposes attributes that allow the position of the `dropdown-content` relative to the `dropdown-trigger` to be configured.
